Opvious Python SDK
  • API reference
  • View page source

API reference

class opvious.Attempt(uuid: str, started_at: datetime, outline: Outline, url: str)

Bases: object

Queueable optimization attempt

outline: Outline

The specification outline corresponding to this attempt

started_at: datetime

The time the attempt was created

url: str

The optimimization hub URL for this attempt

uuid: str

The attempt’s unique identifier

class opvious.AttemptRequest(formulation_name: str, specification_tag_name: str, inputs: SolveInputs)

Bases: object

Attempt creation request

formulation_name: str

The underlying formulation’s name

inputs: SolveInputs

Input data

specification_tag_name: str

The target specification tag

class opvious.CancelledOutcome

Bases: object

The solve was cancelled before a solution was found

class opvious.Client(executor: Executor, api_url: str, hub_url: str)

Bases: object

Opvious API client

property authenticated

Returns true if the client was created with a non-empty API token

async cancel_attempt(uuid: str) → bool

Cancels a running attempt

This method will throw if the attempt does not exist or is not pending anymore.

Parameters:

uuid – The target attempt’s ID

async fetch_attempt_inputs(attempt: Attempt) → SolveInputs

Retrieves an attempt’s inputs

Parameters:

attempt – The target attempt

async fetch_attempt_outputs(attempt: Attempt) → SolveOutputs

Retrieves a successful attempt’s outputs

This method will throw if the attempt did not have a feasible solution.

Parameters:

attempt – The target attempt

classmethod from_environment(env: dict[str, str] | None = None, require_authenticated=False) → Client

Creates a client from environment variables

Parameters:

  • env – Environment, defaults to os.environ.

  • require_authenticated – Throw if the environment does not include a valid API token.

classmethod from_token(token: str, domain: str | None = None) → Client

Creates a client from an API token

Parameters:

  • token – API token. You can use an empty token to create an unauthenticated client with limited functionality.

  • domain – API domain. You should only need to set this if you are using a self-hosted cluster. Defaults to the default production endpoint.

async inspect_solve_instructions(specification: Specification, parameters: Mapping[str, TensorArgument] | None = None, dimensions: Mapping[str, DimensionArgument] | None = None, relaxation: Relaxation | None = None, options: SolveOptions | None = None) → str

Inspects an optimization problem’s representation in LP format

Parameters:

  • specification – Model sources

  • parameters – Input data

  • dimensions – Input keys. If omitted, these will be automatically inferred from the parameters.

  • relaxation – Model relaxation configuration

  • options – Solve options

async load_attempt(uuid: str) → Attempt | None

Loads an existing attempt

Parameters:

uuid – The target attempt’s ID

async poll_attempt(attempt: Attempt) → Notification | Outcome

Polls an attempt for its outcome or latest progress notification

Parameters:

attempt – The target attempt

async prepare_attempt_request(specification: str | FormulationSpecification, parameters: Mapping[str, TensorArgument] | None = None, dimensions: Mapping[str, DimensionArgument] | None = None) → AttemptRequest

Assembles and validates inputs for a long-running solve

The returned request can be used to start a long-running solve via start_attempt.

Parameters:

  • specification – Model sources

  • parameters – Input data

  • dimensions – Input keys. If omitted, these will be automatically inferred from the parameters.

async run_solve(specification: Specification, parameters: Mapping[str, TensorArgument] | None = None, dimensions: Mapping[str, DimensionArgument] | None = None, relaxation: Relaxation | None = None, options: SolveOptions | None = None, assert_feasible=False, prefer_streaming=True) → SolveResponse

Solves an optimization problem

See also start_attempt for an alternative for long-running solves.

Parameters:

  • specification – Model sources

  • parameters – Input data

  • dimensions – Input keys. If omitted, these will be automatically inferred from the parameters.

  • relaxation – Model relaxation configuration

  • options – Solve options

  • assert_feasible – Throw if the final outcome was not feasible

  • prefer_streaming – Show real time progress notifications when possible

async start_attempt(request: AttemptRequest, relaxation: None | Relaxation = None, options: SolveOptions | None = None) → Attempt

Starts a new asynchronous solve attempt

Parameters:

  • request – Attempt configuration, typically generated via prepare_attempt_request

  • relaxation – Model relaxation configuration

  • options – Solve options

async wait_for_outcome(attempt: Attempt, assert_feasible=False) → Outcome

Waits for the attempt to complete and returns its outcome

This method emits real-time progress messages as INFO logs.

Parameters:

attempt – The target attempt

class opvious.ClientSettings(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)

Bases: Enum

Client configuration environment variables

DOMAIN = 'OPVIOUS_DOMAIN'
TOKEN = 'OPVIOUS_TOKEN'

class opvious.Executor(variant: str, root_url: str, authorization: str | None = None, supports_streaming=False)

Bases: object

Generic HTTP request executor

property authenticated

Whether requests use an API authorization header

execute(result_type: Type[ExpectedExecutorResult], url: str, method: str = 'GET', headers: dict[str, str] | None = None, json_data: Any | None = None) → AsyncIterator[ExpectedExecutorResult]

Send a request

async execute_graphql_query(query: str, variables: Mapping[str, Any] | None = None) → Any

Send a GraphQL API request

exception opvious.ExecutorError(status: int, trace: str | None = None, data: Any | None = None)

Bases: Exception

Local representation of an error during an executor’s request

class opvious.FailedOutcome(status: str, message: str, code: str | None, tags: Any)

Bases: object

The solve failed

code: str | None

The underlying error’s error code

message: str

The underlying error’s message

status: str

The underlying error’s status

tags: Any

Structured data associated with the failure

class opvious.FeasibleOutcome(is_optimal: bool, objective_value: float | int | None, relative_gap: float | int | None)

Bases: object

A solution was found

is_optimal: bool

Whether this solution was optimal (within gap thresholds)

objective_value: float | int | None

The solution’s objective value

relative_gap: float | int | None

The solution’s relative gap (0.1 is 10%)

class opvious.FormulationSpecification(formulation_name: str, tag_name: str | None = None)

Bases: object

A specification from a stored formulation. This type of specification allows starting attempts and is recommended for production use as it provides history and reproducibility when combined with tag names.

formulation_name: str
tag_name: str | None = None
class opvious.InfeasibleOutcome

Bases: object

No feasible solution exists

class opvious.InlineSpecification(sources: list[str])

Bases: AnonymousSpecification

A model specification from inline sources. See also LocalSpecification for reading specifications from locally stored files.

async fetch_sources(_executor: Executor) → list[str]
sources: list[str]
opvious.Label

alias of str

class opvious.LocalSpecification(paths: list[str])

Bases: AnonymousSpecification

A model specification from local files. See also InlineSpecification for creating specifications directly from strings.

async fetch_sources(_executor: Executor) → list[str]
classmethod globs(*likes: str, root: str | None = None) → LocalSpecification

Creates a local specification from file globs. As a convenience the root can be a file’s name, in which case it will be interpreted as its parent directory (this is typically handy when used with __file__).

paths: list[str]
class opvious.Notification(dequeued: bool, relative_gap: float | int | None, lp_iteration_count: int | None, cut_count: int | None)

Bases: object

Attempt progress update notification

cut_count: int | None

The latest cut count

dequeued: bool

Whether the attempt has already been dequeued

lp_iteration_count: int | None

The latest LP iteration count

relative_gap: float | int | None

The latest relative gap

class opvious.Outline(objective: 'Optional[ObjectiveOutline]', dimensions: 'Mapping[Label, DimensionOutline]', parameters: 'Mapping[Label, TensorOutline]', variables: 'Mapping[Label, TensorOutline]', constraints: 'Mapping[Label, ConstraintOutline]')

class opvious.Relaxation(penalty: 'RelaxationPenalty' = 'TOTAL_DEVIATION', objective_weight: 'Optional[float]' = None, constraints: 'Optional[list[ConstraintRelaxation]]' = None)

Bases: object

constraints: list[opvious.data.solves.ConstraintRelaxation] | None = None
classmethod from_constraint_labels(labels: list[str], penalty: str = 'TOTAL_DEVIATION', objective_weight: float | None = None) → Relaxation

Relaxes all input constraints using a common penalty.
